intro: Magallana, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Goodeniaceae. These plants are typically found in coastal regions and are adapted to saline and sandy environments. They are characterized by their distinctive blue or purple flowers and spiky, silver-green leaves. Magallana species often have a compact growth habit and are valued for their ornamental appeal in gardens. They play an important role in stabilizing coastal dunes and supporting local wildlife.
